p:
Integrating climate change and occupational health information into a comprehensive adaptation planning process may yield the largest health improvements and savings.
[193,194] Tools to enable this include checklists for scenarios involving increased prevalence, severity, or distribution of occupational safety and health hazards; inventories and maps of resources, capacity, and vulnerability; partnerships between decision makers and occupational safety and health resource groups; and regional or national symposia to discuss strategies and identify collaborative opportunities. This updated framework and priorities for action provide additional tools to assist the occupational safety and health and public health communities to protect workers from potential hazards and adverse impacts of climate change.
